RTCRtpCodecParameters.summary: The dictionary, part of the WebRTC API, is used to describe the configuration parameters for a single media {{Glossary("codec")}}.

remarks.para:
It's used in , and .
Its also use used when calling to configure a transceiver's codecs before beginning the offer/answer process to establish a WebRTC peer connection.

Most of the fields in this property take values which are defined and maintained by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA). References to relevant IANA documents are provided in the see also section at the end of this article.
-Real-Time Transport Protocol (RTP) Parameters-: The IANA document providing registries of permitted values for the RTP parameters used by this dictionary.
